case_title: SHAH MUHAMMAD KHAN vs GHULAM QADIR ETC.
complaint_summary: Ghulam Qadir filed a suit for declaration claiming half of the compensation for land surrendered by his father under Martial Law Regulation 64, alleging the land was gifted to him.
investigation_summary: Issues were struck on 21-6-1963. Defendant sought amendment of the written statement, leading to additional issues regarding jurisdiction. Defendant later filed an application under Order XIV, rule 2, which was dismissed.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the petition, stating the trial court properly exercised discretion in interlocutory matters. The petitioner's application was deemed to lack merit and suffered from laches.
legal_arguments: Faqir Chand v. Mst. Bibi Zulekha

legal_terms.laches: Unreasonable delay in asserting a legal right.

words_and_phrases.interlocutory matters: Issues decided during the course of a trial, not final judgment.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved a dispute over compensation for land surrendered under Martial Law Regulation 64. The petitioner sought amendments and raised jurisdictional issues late in the proceedings. The court upheld the trial court's discretion and dismissed the petition with costs.
